API¶

Data Logger¶

class flogger.DataLogger¶

Stores and save various type of data under various forms.

declare(entry, on_push_callables, on_dump_callables, on_reset_callables)¶

Register a recurring log entry.

Registering an entry gives access to the push, reset and dump methods. Note that all the handlers must be able to handle the data that will be pushed.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • on_push_callables (List[handlers]) – Handlers called on data when push is called.
  • on_reset_callables (List[handlers]) – Handlers called on data when reset is called.
  • on_dump_callables (List[handlers]) – Handlers called on the data when dump is called.
dump()¶

Calls handlers declared for on_dump event, for all registered log entries.

get_entry_length(entry)¶

Retrieves the number of data saved for a log entry.

Parameters:entry (string) – Name of the log entry
Returns:Number of data pieces in the entry storage
Return type:int
get_serie(entry)¶

Returns the data in a list ordered by keys.

Parameters:entry (string) – Name of the log entry
Returns:Serie of data ordered by key
Return type:List[any]
push(entry, value, time=None)¶

Append data to a recurring log.

All handlers registered for the on_push event will be called.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry
  • value (Any) – Object containing the data to log. Should be of same type from call to call…
  • or None time (int) – Date of the logging (epoch, iteration, tic …). Will be used as key in the data

dictionary. If None, the last data key plus one will be used.

reset(entry)¶

Resets the data of a recurring log entry.

All handlers registered for the on_reset event will be called before the storage is emptied.

Parameters:entry (string) – name of the log entry.
set_name(name)¶

Sets the name of the logger.

Parameters:name (string) – Name of the logger
set_path(path)¶

Sets the root path of the logger. Used by all the handlers that write on disk.

Parameters:path (string) – A valid path to write the data in.
set_pool(pool, n_par=5)¶

Sets the executor to be used to call handlers.

Parameters:
  • pool (string) – The type of executor to use to call handlers. Either “thread” or “process”.
  • n_par (int) – The number of executor to use.
wait(log_durations=True)¶

Wait for the handling queue to be emptied.

Parameters:log_durations (bool) – Whether to log the wait duration.

Handlers¶

This module contains handlers for the DataLogger class.

flogger.handlers.add_tsb_image_last(entry, data, path='.', subfolder='', **kwargs)¶

Handler that append the last image of the data to a tensorboard event file.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array / torch tensor of shape [3, W, H]
  • subfolder (string) – Subfolder in which put the data
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.add_tsb_scalar_last(entry, data, subfolder='', path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that appends the last item of the data dictionary to a tensorboard event file.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a number
  • subfolder (string) – Subfolder in which put the data
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.add_tsb_scalars_last(entry, data, labels=None, path='.', subfolder='', **kwargs)¶

Handler that appends the last item of the data dictionary to a tensorboard event file.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be numpy arrays of size [n] with constant n.
  • labels (List[string]) – Labels to use for the lines
  • subfolder (string) – Subfolder in which put the data
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.echo_last(entry, data, output='stdout', **kwargs)¶

Handler that prints the last data item to a standard stream.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
  • output (string) – The stream to echo to. Either “stdout” or “stderr”.
flogger.handlers.log_critical_last(entry, data, **kwargs)¶

Handler that logs a critical level message of the last data item.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
flogger.handlers.log_debug_last(entry, data, **kwargs)¶

Handler that logs a debug level message of the last data item.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
flogger.handlers.log_error_last(entry, data, **kwargs)¶

Handler that logs an error level message of the last data item.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
flogger.handlers.log_info_last(entry, data, **kwargs)¶

Handler that logs an info level message of the last data item.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
flogger.handlers.log_warning_last(entry, data, **kwargs)¶

Handler that logs a warning level message of the last data item.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable.
flogger.handlers.save_to_gif(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores all images of the data dictionary to a gif.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [W, H]
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_gif_last(entry, data, fps=5, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the last item of the data dictionary to a gif.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [N, 3, W, H] or of shape [N, 1, W, H]
  • fps (int) – The framerate
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_jpg(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores all images of a dictionary to a concatenated jpg.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [3, W, H]
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_jpg_last(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the last item of the data dictionary to a jpg.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [3, W, H] or of shape [1, W, H]
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_json(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the whole data dictionary in a json file named after the log entry.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be JSON serializable data.
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_json_last(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the last item in data dictionary in a json file named after the log entry.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be JSON serializable data.
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_mp4(entry, data, fps=5, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores all images of the data dictionary to a mp4.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [3, W, H]
  • fps (int) – Framerate
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_mp4_last(entry, data, fps=5, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the last item of the data dictionary to a mp4.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [N, 3, W, H] or of shape [N, 1, W, H]
  • fps (int) – Framerate
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_mpl_histolines(entry, data, color='navy', path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the whole data dictionary in a matplotlib histogram lines figure.

The data dictionary must store numpy vectors representing the bounds of the different histogram classes. Those can be extracted calling np.histogram_bin_edges( . , 10) with a odd number of classes.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be numpy arrays of shape [N]
  • color (string) – Color of the plot. Must be a valid matplotlib color string.
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_mpl_lines(entry, data, labels=None, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the whole data dictionary in a matplotlib line figure written in a file named after the log entry.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be a numpy array of shape [N]
  • labels (List[string]) – Labels to use for the plot
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_text(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the whole data dictionary in a text file named after the log entry.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
flogger.handlers.save_to_text_last(entry, data, path='.', **kwargs)¶

Handler that stores the last item in data dictionary in a text file named after the log entry.

Parameters:
  • entry (string) – Name of the log entry.
  • data (Dict) – Data should be printable
  • path (string) – Root path. Set by DataLogger if used as handler.
